interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Sound of Music Live! Review Date: 2014/01/02 Store: Carrie Underwood (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor), Beth McCarthy-Miller (Director), Rob Ashford (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Emmy Central, Emmy Nominees Product Description: ["An aspiring nun in pre-WWII Austria leaves the abbey to become a governess for the widower Captain von Trapp's seven children and finds herself falling in love. Beloved worldwide, The Sound of Music includes unforgettable songs including “Edelweiss”, “Do-Re-Mi,” “My Favorite Things,” and “The Sound of Music”."] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '274264', 'Director': 'Beth McCarthy-Miller, Rob Ashford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Carrie Underwood, Stephen Moyer, Laura Benanti, Christian Borle, Audra McDonald', 'Producers': 'Priscilla Taussig', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: There is a good reason why the original 1959 broadway version is basically lost to time and unknown while the movie version that followed is known to nearly everyone and widely beloved. The movie version rocks and the broadway version in comparision suxs.

Thus having painfully sat through this remake of the broadway version I will rate it a tedious and un-interesting if not embarrassing. Additionally the audio mix in the new one is terrible (or the lead has a very weak voice) and the stage is poor.

Overall nothing in this new version sparkles...I would rate it lower that a typical high school drama club presentation of Fiddler on the Roof...except here I no children I am related to to compele me to attend. And I am sorry I did. Review Title: Poor at best... Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Defying Gravity: Season 1 Livingston, Ron (Actor), Airlie, Andrew (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Fox TV, General ['Set in the very near future, eight astronauts from five countries undertake a mysterious six-year international mission on the spaceship Antares. This sexy and provocative sci fi thriller follows 4 men and 4 women through the solar system where their pasts reveal intimate and interconnected secrets that have a strange effect on the present and mysteries yet to be revealed. DVD includes 5 episodes never seen on television.'] {'Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Yoba, Malik, Airlie, Andrew, Livingston, Ron', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '109899521990', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 19, 2010', 'Actors': 'Livingston, Ron, Airlie, Andrew, Yoba, Malik', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Number of discs': '4'} Good series, better on DVD w/o dumb commercials to interrupt.

Want show brought back!! Good series, better on DVD The Sound of Music Live! Carrie Underwood (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor), Beth McCarthy-Miller (Director), Rob Ashford (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Emmy Central, Emmy Nominees ["An aspiring nun in pre-WWII Austria leaves the abbey to become a governess for the widower Captain von Trapp's seven children and finds herself falling in love. Beloved worldwide, The Sound of Music includes unforgettable songs including “Edelweiss”, “Do-Re-Mi,” “My Favorite Things,” and “The Sound of Music”."] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '274264', 'Director': 'Beth McCarthy-Miller, Rob Ashford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Carrie Underwood, Stephen Moyer, Laura Benanti, Christian Borle, Audra McDonald', 'Producers': 'Priscilla Taussig', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} There is a good reason why the original 1959 broadway version is basically lost to time and unknown while the movie version that followed is known to nearly everyone and widely beloved. The movie version rocks and the broadway version in comparision suxs.

Thus having painfully sat through this remake of the broadway version I will rate it a tedious and un-interesting if not embarrassing. Additionally the audio mix in the new one is terrible (or the lead has a very weak voice) and the stage is poor.

Overall nothing in this new version sparkles...I would rate it lower that a typical high school drama club presentation of Fiddler on the Roof...except here I no children I am related to to compele me to attend. And I am sorry I did. Poor at best...
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** Strong interest in sci-fi and character-driven series that blend drama with intriguing plots and interpersonal relationships. Recent reviews suggest an appreciation for classic and musical content, although with critical discernment.
- **Format Preference:** Favors DVD or box set formats for viewing, valuing an uninterrupted experience without commercials. This preference extends to musical adaptations as well.
- **Quality Seeking:** Values high-quality production and storytelling, as evidenced by a strong rating for engaging series. The latest interaction reveals a low tolerance for subpar performances, particularly in adaptations of beloved classics.
- **Nostalgic Interest:** Shows a desire for ongoing connection to past favorites, indicating a preference for series and adaptations that may have been discontinued or ended. The critical review highlights the importance of comparison to original works.
- **Engagement Style:** Engages actively by reviewing and expressing opinions on content, indicating thoughtful consumption and awareness of media quality. Recent feedback reflects a willingness to critique and express disappointment when expectations are not met.

Overall, this user exhibits a distinct affinity for immersive TV experiences and high-quality productions, demonstrating a nuanced appreciation for both modern and classic narratives while maintaining a critical eye on adaptations.
